observations: The output height is greater than the input height.
The width remains constant between input and output.
The top portion of the output is identical to the input.
The pattern from the top is repeated downwards until the output height is reached.
hypotheses: Copy the input grid to the top of the output, then reflect the content along the horizontal center to fill the rest of the grid.
Copy the input grid to the top of the output, and then repeat the input rows downwards to fill the remaining rows in the output.
Copy the input grid to the top of the output, then copy the first row of the input to fill the remaining rows in the output.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Copy the input grid to the top of the output, then reflect the content along the horizontal center to fill the rest of the grid.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Example 1 does not show reflection symmetry. The repeated sections are identical to the top part, not reflected.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Copy the input grid to the top of the output, then copy the first row of the input to fill the remaining rows in the output.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Examples show the entire input pattern repeated downwards, not just the first row.

selected_rule: Copy the input grid to the top of the output, and then repeat the input rows downwards to fill the remaining rows in the output.
step_plan: Copy the input grid to the top of the output grid.
Repeat the rows of the input grid to fill the remaining empty rows of the output grid.
